Low Latent Inhibition - Neurocognitive Mechanisms, Psychopathology, and Creativity

Notes Psychopathology

Definition and Foundations of Latent Inhibition (LI)

Latent inhibition (LI) is a cognitive phenomenon first identified in animal learning research over 60 years ago. It refers to the slowing or impairment of new learning about a stimulus due to prior repeated exposure to that stimulus without any consequence. In classical conditioning terms, an organism that has been pre-exposed to a neutral stimulus (one that initially has no significance) will take longer to form an association with that stimulus later when it is paired with an important outcome, compared to an organism encountering the stimulus for the first time. In other words, familiar stimuli are automatically screened out as irrelevant – a latent (hidden) “inhibition” of learning occurs because the stimulus was previously deemed unimportant. This filtering mechanism is highly adaptive: it conserves cognitive resources by preventing information overload, allowing attention to focus on novel or meaningful stimuli while background, inconsequential inputs are ignored. Indeed, “normal” latent inhibition is thought to be an evolutionarily beneficial form of selective attention, helping organisms efficiently navigate complex environments by tuning out constant, irrelevant sensory input.

潜在抑制（Latent Inhibition, 简称 LI）是一种认知现象，最早于 60 多年前在动物学习研究中被发现。它指的是由于之前在无后果的情况下反复接触某一刺激，导致随后对该刺激进行新学习的速度减慢或受损。用经典条件反射（Classical Conditioning）的话术来说，与初次接触某一刺激的个体相比，如果一个有机体预先暴露于一个中性刺激（最初没有意义的刺激）中，那么当该刺激随后与某个重要结果配对时，该有机体需要更长的时间才能建立起关联。换言之，熟悉的刺激会被自动筛选掉并视为无关——由于该刺激此前被判定为不重要，从而产生了一种“潜伏的”（隐藏的）学习“抑制”。这种过滤机制具有高度的适应性：它通过防止信息过载来节省认知资源，使注意力能够集中在原创或有意义的刺激上，同时忽略背景性的、无关紧要的输入。事实上，“正常”的潜在抑制被认为是一种具有进化益处的选择性注意形式，它通过屏蔽恒常且无关的感官输入，帮助有机体有效地应对复杂的环境。

Low latent inhibition (LLI), by contrast, describes a state or trait in which this filtering mechanism is diminished – stimuli that would ordinarily be filtered out as irrelevant are not inhibited and instead flood into conscious awareness. An individual with LLI exhibits a “leaky” attentional style, finding it difficult to ignore or suppress even trivial stimuli. Essentially, familiar stimuli retain a high degree of salience rather than being dismissed as background noise. Psychologically, this means a person with low latent inhibition is constantly noticing details and perceiving connections that others might overlook. Research has consistently shown that reduced latent inhibition is associated with a greater breadth of uncensored information entering one’s attention, which can manifest in two very different ways: heightened creativity or cognitive overload. On one hand, allowing more disparate information into awareness may foster creative insight by increasing the pool of remote ideas and stimuli available for combination. On the other hand, failure to filter stimuli can also lead to distractibility and overwhelm, as the mind is bombarded with extraneous input that would normally be ignored. This duality has made LLI a subject of great interest across multiple fields – from neuroscience and cognitive psychology to psychopathology and creativity research.

相比之下，低潜在抑制（LLI）描述的是一种这种过滤机制减弱的状态或特质——那些通常会被作为无关信息过滤掉的刺激未被抑制，反而涌入了意识觉知。LLI 个体表现出一种“渗漏型”的注意风格（leaky attentional style），发现自己很难忽略或压抑即便微不足道的刺激。本质上，熟悉的刺激保持了高度的显著性（Salience），而不是被当作背景噪音撇除。从心理学角度看，这意味着低潜在抑制者会不断注意到他人可能忽略的细节并察觉到其中的联系。研究一致表明，潜在抑制的降低与进入个人注意力的未经审查信息的广度增加有关，这可能以两种截然不同的方式体现：高度的创造力或认知过载。一方面，让更多异质信息进入意识可能会通过增加可供组合的远程创意和刺激库，从而促进创造性洞察。另一方面，无法过滤刺激也可能导致分心和崩溃，因为大脑被那些通常会被忽略的无关输入所轰炸。这种双重性使得 LLI 成为跨学科研究的热点——从神经科学和认知心理学到精神病理学和创造力研究。

In foundational studies, latent inhibition was demonstrated across species (from rodents to humans), indicating it is a robust and general feature of learning and attention. For example, in a classic human paradigm by Ginton et al., participants were first repeatedly exposed to a background sound (a white noise) with no outcomes; later, when that sound was assigned significance (paired with a points reward in a game), participants who had the prior exposure learned the new association much more slowly than those with no pre-exposure – evidence of the latent inhibition effect. Such experiments established the basic concept that prior irrelevant exposure retards subsequent learning, due to reduced attention or “learned irrelevance.” Under typical conditions, the mind uses context and experience to decide that a previously seen stimulus is safe to ignore, thereby inhibiting further processing of it. LLI can be thought of as a breakdown or reduction of this normal selective attention process. Instead of habituating to a repeated benign stimulus, the individual with LLI continues to register it as novel or significant. This concept was initially of interest in clinical psychology because certain mental disorders seemed to involve this very inability to filter – patients appeared overwhelmed by stimuli that others would tune out. The connection between LLI and psychopathology was first noted in schizophrenia research (discussed further below), but has since been expanded to other conditions and to positive traits like creativity. Today, latent inhibition serves as a theoretical bridge between neuroscience, psychopathology, and creativity, as researchers examine how an attenuated filtering system can be a double-edged sword contributing to mental illness symptoms in some cases and to original, innovative thinking in others.

在基础研究中，潜在抑制在不同物种（从啮齿动物到人类）中都得到了证实，表明它是学习和注意力的一个稳固且普遍的特征。例如，在 Ginton 等人的一项经典人类范式实验中，参与者首先反复暴露于一种背景声音（白噪音）且没有任何结果；随后，当该声音被赋予意义（在游戏中与积分奖励挂钩）时，预先暴露过的参与者学习新关联的速度比没有预先暴露的参与者慢得多——这便是潜在抑制效应的证据。此类实验确立了这样一个基本概念：由于注意力降低或“习得性无关”（Learned Irrelevance），先前的无关暴露会阻碍后续学习。在典型条件下，大脑利用语境和经验来判定一个先前见过的刺激是可以安全忽略的，从而抑制对其的进一步加工。LLI 可以被视为这种正常选择性注意过程的崩溃或削减。LLI 个体不会对重复的良性刺激产生习惯化（Habituation），而是继续将其登记为新颖或显著的。这一概念最初引起临床心理学的关注，是因为某些精神障碍似乎正涉及这种无法过滤的能力——患者似乎被他人会屏蔽掉的刺激所淹没。LLI 与精神病理学之间的联系最早在精神分裂症研究中被注意到，但此后已扩展到其他症状以及如创造力等积极特质。如今，潜在抑制充当了神经科学、精神病理学和创造力之间的理论桥梁，研究人员正借此探讨这种减弱的过滤系统如何成为一把双刃剑：在某些情况下导致精神疾病症状，而在另一些情况下则贡献了原创性的革新思维。

Neurobiological and Cognitive Mechanisms Underlying LLI

Cognitive–Attentional Mechanisms: The mechanisms of latent inhibition can be understood on two levels: cognitive (how the mind classifies and attends to stimuli) and neurobiological (brain circuits and neurotransmitters involved in gating information). Cognitively, two main theoretical explanations for LI have been debated. Attentional theories posit that during the repeated pre-exposure to a stimulus, the brain actively learns that this stimulus is irrelevant, leading to a decline in the stimulus’s perceived salience or “attention weight.” By the time conditioning is attempted, the stimulus no longer commands attention, so learning about it is impaired. In simpler terms, the subject has tuned out the stimulus – “I’ve seen this, it means nothing, I can ignore it.” Lubow’s conditioned attention theory is a classic example, suggesting that an association is formed during pre-exposure that the stimulus predicts “no consequences,” and this association interferes with new learning about the stimulus. On the other hand, retrieval/competition theories argue that the stimulus is learned about normally during conditioning, but when trying to retrieve what the stimulus means, two memories compete: the older “stimulus → no outcome” memory vs. the newer “stimulus → important outcome” memory. The older memory of irrelevance interferes with expression of the new learning. In practice, both attentional reduction and memory competition likely contribute, and modern views consider them complementary parts of the latent inhibition process. The key point is that latent inhibition reflects an adaptive cognitive filtering – whether by reduced attention or competing memory, the organism preferentially maintains its prior belief that the stimulus is inconsequential. This cognitive inhibition prevents distraction and information overload. In low latent inhibition, this filtering process is weakened. The individual continues to allocate attention to stimuli that should have become background, or the “irrelevant” label fails to stick in memory. Consequently, familiar inputs keep a high novelty value, and the person may consciously notice aspects of the environment that others automatically disregard. This aligns with what has been called a state of “cognitive disinhibition,” where the normal constraints on thought and perception are loosened. Psychologist H.J. Eysenck and others theorized that such reduced latent inhibition (or cognitive disinhibition) is a factor underlying both creative cognition and certain psychotic symptoms, as it permits unusual associations and experiences to reach awareness.

认知-注意机制： 潜在抑制（LI）的机制可以从两个层面来理解：认知层面（大脑如何对刺激进行分类和注意）以及神经生物学层面（涉及信息门控的脑回路和神经递质）。在认知层面，关于 LI 的两种主要理论解释一直存在争议。注意理论（Attentional theories）认为，在刺激的反复预暴露过程中，大脑主动习得了该刺激是无关的，从而导致刺激的感知显著性或“注意权重”下降。当尝试进行条件反射学习时，该刺激已不再能吸引注意力，因此对其的学习受到损害。简单来说，主体已经屏蔽了该刺激——“我见过这个，它毫无意义，我可以忽略它”。鲁博（Lubow）的条件注意理论是一个经典例子，该理论认为在预暴露期间形成了一种“刺激预测无后果”的联结，这种联结干扰了随后对该刺激的新学习。另一方面，提取/竞争理论（Retrieval/competition theories）则认为，在条件反射阶段，个体对刺激的学习是正常进行的，但在尝试提取刺激的含义时，两段记忆发生了竞争：旧的“刺激 → 无结果”记忆与新的“刺激 → 重要结果”记忆。旧的无关性记忆干扰了新学习成果的表现。在实践中，注意力的降低和记忆竞争可能共同起作用，现代观点将其视为潜在抑制过程中互补的部分。核心观点在于，潜在抑制反映了一种适应性的认知过滤——无论是通过降低注意力还是记忆竞争，有机体都会优先维持其先前的信念，即该刺激是无关紧要的。这种认知抑制防止了分心和信息过载。在低潜在抑制（LLI）中，这一过滤过程被削弱了。个体继续向那些本应成为背景的刺激分配注意力，或者“无关”的标签未能牢固地留在记忆中。因此，熟悉的输入保持了高度的新颖价值，个体可能会有意识地注意到他人自动忽视的环境细节。这与所谓的“认知去抑制（Cognitive disinhibition）”状态一致，即对思维和感知的正常约束被放宽了。心理学家艾森克（H.J. Eysenck）等人推论，这种降低的潜在抑制（或认知去抑制）是创造性认知和某些精神病症状共同的潜在因素，因为它允许不寻常的联结和经验进入意识。

Neurobiological Mechanisms and Dopamine: Biologically, latent inhibition and its attenuation (LLI) are mediated by a distributed brain network heavily involving the dopamine neurotransmitter system and specific regions in the hippocampus–striatal–prefrontal circuit. Latent inhibition has strong links to the brain’s dopamine-regulated salience network – experiments have shown that elevating dopamine activity can disrupt latent inhibition, while blocking dopamine (as antipsychotic drugs do) can enhance or restore latent inhibition. This is dramatically demonstrated in animal studies: for instance, giving a dopamine-releasing stimulant (like amphetamine) to rats abolishes the latent inhibition effect (the animals start responding to previously irrelevant stimuli as if they were important), but administering dopamine-blocking antipsychotics prevents this disruption. The implication is that dopamine signals in the brain modulate whether stimuli are treated as salient or as background. High dopamine states (such as those hypothesized in psychosis or induced by stimulants) tend to assign significance even to previously irrelevant cues – essentially turning latent inhibition “off” and producing an LLI state. In contrast, normalizing dopamine allows the filtering mechanism to function, keeping trivia out of mind. The nucleus accumbens (NAc), a dopamine-rich region of the ventral striatum, appears to be a critical hub in this process. The NAc interacts with the hippocampus (which provides context and novelty evaluation) and the prefrontal cortex (which contributes top-down regulation of attention) to determine the salience of stimuli. Notably, research shows a functional division of labor in the accumbens: the NAc shell is required for developing latent inhibition (learning to ignore a stimulus), while the NAc core helps flexibly update or switch attention when needed. Lesions of the accumbens shell eliminate latent inhibition (animals can no longer treat any stimulus as irrelevant), whereas lesions of the accumbens core cause an excess of latent inhibition (animals continue ignoring a stimulus even when it becomes important). These findings underscore that properly calibrating the “gating” of stimuli depends on finely tuned dopamine activity in this circuit. The ventral hippocampus (subiculum) provides input to the NAc and seems to signal whether the context predicts that a stimulus is meaningful or not, influencing dopamine neuron firing accordingly. If the hippocampus labels the stimulus as familiar and inconsequential (after repetition), it may suppress dopamine-driven salience for that input, thereby producing latent inhibition. Supporting this, hippocampal inactivation or damage can disrupt context-based latent inhibition and its persistence. The amygdala (basolateral amygdala) is another player: amygdala lesions have been found to potentiate latent inhibition, causing an exaggerated and inflexible ignoring of stimuli. This suggests the amygdala (often involved in attaching significance or emotional “tagging” to stimuli) normally counterbalances latent inhibition by allowing important stimuli to grab attention; without amygdala input, animals might over-filter and miss changing significance. Finally, the prefrontal cortex (PFC), especially the ventromedial PFC, is thought to exert executive control over these gating processes. A recent study showed that blocking GABA (inhibitory signaling) in rat PFC – effectively disinhibiting the PFC – abolished latent inhibition entirely. This indicates the PFC’s inhibitory tone is required for successful filtering (possibly by inhibiting dopamine or amygdala drives that would otherwise assign salience to the stimulus). Overall, convergent evidence points to a network including the hippocampus, nucleus accumbens, amygdala, and prefrontal cortex as the neural circuitry of latent inhibition. Low latent inhibition can thus result from dysfunction or imbalance in this circuit – for example, a hyperdopaminergic state or a weakened prefrontal regulatory control can tilt the system toward tagging even mundane stimuli as novel/significant. This aligns well with the known neurobiology of schizophrenia (hyperdopaminergia in the striatum, PFC dysregulation) and of divergent thinking states (which may involve transiently reduced frontal oversight).

神经生物学机制与多巴胺： 在生物学上，潜在抑制及其减弱（LLI）由一个涉及多巴胺神经递质系统以及海马-纹状体-前额叶回路中特定区域的分布式大脑网络介导。潜在抑制与大脑中受多巴胺调节的显著性网络有很强的联系——实验表明，提高多巴胺活性会破坏潜在抑制，而阻断多巴胺（如抗精神病药物的作用）则会增强或恢复潜在抑制。这在动物研究中得到了戏剧性的证实：例如，给大鼠注射促多巴胺释放的兴奋剂（如苯丙胺）会消除潜在抑制效应（动物开始对先前无关的刺激做出反应，仿佛它们很重要），而施用阻断多巴胺的抗精神病药则能防止这种破坏。这意味着，大脑中的多巴胺信号调节了刺激是被视为显著的还是背景性的。高多巴胺状态（如在精神病假设中或由兴奋剂诱导的状态）倾向于赋予即便先前无关的线索以重要性——本质上是“关闭”了潜在抑制并产生 LLI 状态。相比之下，使多巴胺恢复正常可以使过滤机制运作，将琐事挡在脑外。伏隔核（NAc）是腹侧纹状体中一个多巴胺含量丰富的区域，似乎是这一过程中的关键枢纽。伏隔核与海马（提供背景和新颖性评估）以及前额叶皮层（贡献注意力的自上而下调节）相互作用，以确定刺激的显著性。值得注意的是，研究显示伏隔核内部存在功能分工：伏隔核壳层（NAc shell）是产生潜在抑制（学习忽略刺激）所必需的，而伏隔核核心（NAc core）则在需要时帮助灵活地更新或切换注意力。损伤伏隔核壳层会消除潜在抑制（动物不再能将任何刺激视为无关），而损伤伏隔核核心则会导致潜在抑制过度（即使刺激变得重要，动物仍继续忽略它）。这些发现强调，正确校准刺激的“门控”取决于该回路中精细调节的多巴胺活性。腹侧海马（下托）向伏隔核提供输入，并似乎在发出信号，说明语境是否预示某个刺激有意义，从而相应地影响多巴胺神经元的放电。如果海马（在重复之后）将刺激标记为熟悉且无关紧要，它可能会抑制多巴胺驱动的针对该输入的显著性，从而产生潜在抑制。支持这一点的是，海马的功能失活或受损会破坏基于语境的潜在抑制及其持久性。杏仁核（基底侧杏仁核）是另一个参与者：研究发现杏仁核损伤会增强潜在抑制，导致对刺激产生夸张且僵化的忽略。这表明杏仁核（通常参与为刺激附加意义或情感“标记”）通常会制衡潜在抑制，从而允许重要的刺激攫取注意力；如果没有杏仁核的输入，动物可能会过度过滤并错过意义的变化。最后，前额叶皮层（PFC），尤其是腹内侧前额叶，被认为对这些门控过程行使执行控制。最近的一项研究显示，阻断大鼠前额叶中的 GABA（抑制性信号）——有效地使前额叶去抑制——会彻底消除潜在抑制。这表明前额叶的抑制张力是成功过滤所必需的（可能是通过抑制多巴胺或杏仁核的驱动力，否则它们会为刺激分配显著性）。总的来说，会聚的证据指向一个包括海马、伏隔核、杏仁核和前额叶皮层在内的网络作为潜在抑制的神经回路。因此，低潜在抑制可能是由于该回路的功能障碍或失衡导致的——例如，高多巴胺状态或前额叶调节控制减弱，都会使系统倾向于将平庸的刺激标记为新颖/显著。这与已知的精神分裂症神经生物学（纹状体高多巴胺、前额叶调节失灵）以及发散思维状态（可能涉及暂时性的额叶监管降低）非常吻合。

At a more macro level, the neurobiological concept of “aberrant salience” has been proposed to explain positive psychotic symptoms (hallucinations, delusions) in schizophrenia, and latent inhibition is one experimental model to study this phenomenon. The Salience Hypothesis (Kapur, 2003) holds that in psychosis, the dopamine-driven assignment of importance to stimuli (both external and internal) goes awry, so that irrelevant sensory inputs or random thoughts are imbued with inappropriate significance. In support of this, people with acute schizophrenia exhibit attenuated latent inhibition – prior exposure fails to dampen their response to stimuli – indicating they continue to find familiar stimuli overly salient. This is essentially a pathological case of low latent inhibition: the filter is wide open. The flood of stimuli and ideas that results may contribute to hallucinations (e.g. internal thoughts or sounds not being filtered out, thereby experienced as external voices) and delusions (attempts to assign meaning to the plethora of unrelated stimuli that seem important). Thus, at the neural level LLI is often linked to dysregulated dopamine signaling and impaired top-down gating, leading to a state where “redundant stimuli maintain a greater sense of novelty and significance” than they should. It is fascinating that this same basic neurocognitive state – an abundance of unfiltered information – can under different circumstances either manifest as mental illness or as creativity, a theme we will explore in detail.

宏观而言，神经生物学中的“异常显著性（Aberrant salience）”概念已被提出，用于解释精神分裂症中的阳性精神病症状（幻觉、妄想），而潜在抑制是研究这一现象的一种实验模型。显著性假设（Kapur, 2003）认为，在精神病中，多巴胺驱动的刺激重要性分配（包括外部和内部刺激）出了偏差，导致无关的感官输入或随机想法被赋予了不恰当的意义。支持这一点的是，急性精神分裂症患者表现出潜在抑制减弱——先前的暴露未能抑制他们对刺激的反应——表明他们继续发现熟悉的刺激过于显著。这本质上是低潜在抑制的一种病理案例：过滤器被完全打开了。由此产生的刺激和想法的洪流可能导致幻觉（例如内部想法或声音未被过滤掉，从而被体验为外部声音）和妄想（试图为过量的不相关但看似重要的刺激赋予意义）。因此，在神经层面，LLI 通常与失调的多巴胺信号传导和受损的自上而下门控相关联，导致一种“冗余刺激比其应有的状态保持了更强的新颖感和显著性”的状态。引人入胜的是，这种相同的基本神经认知状态——丰富且未经过滤的信息——在不同情况下既可以表现为心理疾病，也可以表现为创造力，这是我们将详细探讨的主题。

Before turning to those applications, it’s worth noting that low latent inhibition is part of a broader class of sensory gating phenomena. Cognitive LLI (measured via learning tasks) correlates with measures of early pre-conscious gating in the brain. For instance, P50 auditory sensory gating – the reduction in brain response to a second repetitive click sound – is typically diminished in schizophrenia and in highly creative individuals, indicating a general failure to filter or “dampen” repetitive stimuli. Similarly, pre-pulse inhibition (PPI) of the startle reflex (another index of filtering, where a weak pre-signal reduces the startle to a loud noise) is often reduced in schizophrenia and ADHD, paralleling the reduced latent inhibition seen in those conditions. These psychophysiological gating deficits support the idea that LLI reflects an underlying loosening of the brain’s filtering mechanisms. In creative populations, lower sensory gating (e.g. a larger P50 response to repeated sounds, meaning less suppression) has been linked to higher divergent thinking fluency and originality. The interpretation is that reduced gating at both low-level (sensory) and higher-level (cognitive) stages gives an individual more raw material from the environment to potentially incorporate into ideas, at the cost of increased distraction. Therefore, LLI can be seen as one facet of an overall “leaky filter” temperament that has mixed consequences. In the next sections we will examine how this plays out behaviorally in different populations, from clinical groups (where LLI may relate to symptoms) to high-functioning creative individuals (where LLI may relate to innovative thinking).

在转向这些应用之前，值得注意的是，低潜在抑制（LLI）属于更广泛的一类感觉门控（Sensory gating）现象。认知层面的 LLI（通过学习任务测量）与大脑中早期的前意识门控指标相关。例如，P50 听觉感觉门控——即大脑对第二次重复点击声反应的减弱——在精神分裂症患者和高创造力个体中通常会减弱，这表明他们普遍无法过滤或“平抑”重复的刺激。类似地，惊跳反射的前脉冲抑制（Prepulse Inhibition, PPI）（另一种过滤指标，即弱预警信号会降低对随后强噪音的惊跳反应）在精神分裂症和多动症（ADHD）中经常降低，这与这些疾病中观察到的潜在抑制减弱相平行。这些心理生理门控缺陷支持了这样一个观点：LLI 反映了大脑过滤机制底层的一种松动。在创造性人群中，较低的感觉门控（例如对重复声音产生更大的 P50 反应，意味着抑制较少）被认为与更高的发散思维流畅性和原创性有关。其解释是，在低层级（感觉）和高层级（认知）阶段同时减少门控，使个体能够从环境中获取更多的原始素材，从而可能将其整合到创意中，但代价是分心程度的增加。因此，LLI 可以被视为整体“渗漏型过滤器”特质的一个方面，具有双重后果。在接下来的章节中，我们将探讨这种特质在不同人群中的行为表现，从临床群体（LLI 可能与症状相关）到高功能创造性个体（LLI 可能与创新思维相关）。

Behavioral Manifestations of LLI in Clinical Populations

Low latent inhibition has been observed in certain clinical and subclinical populations, often in conjunction with characteristic cognitive or behavioral symptoms. Here we detail how LLI manifests in schizophrenia-spectrum disorders, in attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), and in other relevant conditions, highlighting the link between reduced filtering and specific symptomatology.

低潜在抑制已在某些临床和亚临床人群中被观察到，通常与特征性的认知或行为症状相结合。下面我们详细阐述 LLI 在精神分裂症谱系障碍、注意缺陷/多动障碍（ADHD）以及其他相关状况中的表现，强调减弱的过滤机制与特定症状学之间的联系。

Schizophrenia-Spectrum Disorders (Schizophrenia and Schizotypy)

Schizophrenia: Among clinical groups, schizophrenia provided the first evidence of human latent inhibition deficits. Seminal studies in the 1980s by Baruch and colleagues found that patients with acute schizophrenia showed no latent inhibition in a simple auditory conditioning task, whereas healthy controls and even stable chronic schizophrenic patients did show intact latent inhibition. In the acute patients (those in the throes of positive symptoms like hallucinations and delusions), prior exposure to a tone did not hinder their learning about that tone in a later phase – effectively, they failed to treat the tone as irrelevant despite having heard it repeatedly with no consequence. This inability to screen out the previously neutral stimulus aligns with clinical observations that schizophrenic patients experience a flood of unfiltered sensory input and ideas, contributing to confusion and the formation of odd beliefs. Subsequent research has largely reinforced that latent inhibition is often attenuated in schizophrenia, particularly in patients with prominent “positive” symptoms (hallucinations, delusional thinking). The degree of LI deficit tends to correlate with the severity of positive symptoms: the more pronounced the hallucinations or delusional ideation, the weaker the latent inhibition effect measured in the lab. This makes intuitive sense – positive symptoms essentially reflect aberrant salience attribution, and low latent inhibition is one measurable sign that neutral stimuli are being treated as salient. Some studies even find that during acute psychotic episodes (early in the illness or during relapse) patients have virtually no latent inhibition, whereas more stabilized or chronic patients (or those on antipsychotic medications) may partially regain the ability to filter stimuli. Antipsychotic drugs, which block dopamine D2 receptors, are known to restore latent inhibition in animal models, and clinically they reduce positive symptoms, reinforcing the role of dopamine and aberrant salience in these effects. There are, however, some inconsistencies in the literature – not every study finds LI deficits in schizophrenia, likely due to factors like medication status, the specific paradigm used, or heterogeneity of symptoms. For example, heavily medicated patients sometimes show normal latent inhibition in experiments, possibly because their treatment is effectively gating out the excess stimuli (or because the task used a between-subject design with less sensitivity). Additionally, there is evidence that negative symptoms (such as social withdrawal or cognitive slowing) might relate to an opposite pattern: in some cases patients with high negative and low positive symptoms showed exaggerated latent inhibition (so-called “potentiated LI”). This could reflect an overly rigid attentional style in some chronic patients, who may under-assign salience across the board. Nonetheless, the overarching theme is that the acute psychotic state is characterized by low latent inhibition, consistent with patients’ subjective reports of sensory inundation and seeing “signals” in the noise of everyday experience. The salience theory of psychosis maps onto this: stimuli that would normally be tagged as “irrelevant” continue to feel novel or important, driving unusual perceptions and interpretations.

精神分裂症： 在临床群体中，精神分裂症为人类潜在抑制缺陷提供了第一批证据。Baruch 及其同事在 20 世纪 80 年代开展的开创性研究发现，急性精神分裂症患者在简单的听觉条件反射任务中表现出无潜在抑制现象，而健康对照组甚至稳定的慢性精神分裂症患者则表现出完整的潜在抑制。在急性期患者（正处于幻觉和妄想等阳性症状折磨中的患者）中，先前暴露于某种音调并不会阻碍他们在随后的阶段学习该音调——实际上，尽管他们反复听到该音调且没有任何后果，但他们未能将其视为无关信息。这种无法筛选掉先前中性刺激的能力，与临床观察到的精神分裂症患者经历着未经过滤的感官输入和想法的洪流是一致的，这导致了思维混乱和古怪信念的形成。随后的研究很大程度上证实了潜在抑制在精神分裂症中经常衰减，尤其是在具有显著“阳性”症状（幻觉、妄想思维）的患者中。LI 缺陷的程度往往与阳性症状的严重程度相关：幻觉或妄想观念越明显，实验室测得的潜在抑制效应就越弱。这在直觉上是合理的——阳性症状本质上反映了异常的显著性归因（aberrant salience attribution），而低潜在抑制是将中性刺激视为显著刺激的一个可测量信号。一些研究甚至发现，在急性精神病发作期间（发病早期或复发期间），患者几乎没有潜在抑制，而更稳定或慢性的患者（或服用抗精神病药物的患者）可能会部分恢复过滤刺激的能力。抗精神病药物通过阻断多巴胺 D2 受体，已知可以恢复动物模型中的潜在抑制，且在临床上能减轻阳性症状，这进一步强化了多巴胺和异常显著性在这些效应中的作用。然而，文献中也存在一些不一致之处——并非每项研究都发现精神分裂症患者存在 LI 缺陷，这可能是由于用药情况、使用的特定范式或症状异质性等因素造成的。例如，重度用药的患者有时在实验中表现出正常的潜在抑制，这可能是因为他们的治疗有效地过滤掉了多余的刺激（或者是因为任务采用了敏感度较低的组间设计）。此外，有证据表明阴性症状（如社交退缩或认知迟钝）可能与一种相反的模式有关：在某些情况下，具有高阴性症状和低阳性症状的患者表现出增强的潜在抑制（即所谓的“强化 LI”）。这可能反映了一些慢性患者过度僵化的注意风格，他们可能会全面降低显著性的分配。尽管如此，首要主题仍是急性精神病状态以低潜在抑制为特征，这与患者主观报告的感官淹没感以及在日常体验的噪音中看到“信号”的感受相吻合。精神病的显著性理论与此对应：本应被标记为“无关”的刺激持续带来新颖感或重要感，从而驱动了异常的感知和解释。

Schizotypy and Psychosis-Proneness: Beyond clinically diagnosed schizophrenia, researchers have examined schizotypy – a personality/neuropsychological trait reflecting mild versions of schizophrenia-like characteristics in the general population. High-schizotypy individuals (especially those high in positive schizotypy, meaning they have more unusual perceptual experiences and magical ideas rather than just social withdrawal) also demonstrate attenuated latent inhibition in many studies. In classic experiments, students or volunteers scoring high on schizotypy scales learned faster about a pre-exposed stimulus (indicating less LI) than those scoring low, despite all being non-clinical populations. Like with patients, the high schizotypy group assigns greater salience to the pre-exposed cues, failing to ignore them. Interestingly, the LI deficit in schizotypy seems most robust when using measures related to unusual experiences/hallucination-proneness (e.g., the schizotypal personality questionnaire or certain subscales). This suggests that it’s specifically the “psychosis-prone” variant of schizotypy – those who have a rich imaginative or perceptual life – that overlaps with low latent inhibition. In contrast, individuals who are more “withdrawn” or cognitively disorganized without the unusual perceptions might not show the effect as strongly. There have been some nuances in schizotypy studies: for example, one study found that high-schizotypy participants showed LI deficits only after relatively few pre-exposures, but if the stimulus was pre-exposed many times (30+ trials), eventually even high-schizotypy individuals showed latent inhibition. This hints that people prone to psychosis might habituate to redundancy more slowly – the filter does not engage as readily – but given enough repetition they too can learn to ignore a stimulus (i.e. the salience of redundant input declines more gradually). Other studies have used within-subject designs and sometimes failed to find an effect, or found that only certain schizotypy measures correlate with LI, leading to some debate. However, meta-analytically, the weight of evidence indicates that high schizotypy is associated with cross-modal reductions in latent inhibition, mirroring the schizophrenia findings. This extends the idea of LLI as a continuum: even in “normal” populations, those who have a higher genetic or trait load for psychotic-like experiences exhibit a leaky sensory-attentional filter. In fact, schizotypy research is valuable because it avoids medication and hospitalization confounds present in patient studies. The bottom line is that both schizophrenia patients (especially unmedicated and in acute phases) and high-schizotypy individuals show low latent inhibition, which supports the notion that LLI is a core cognitive vulnerability associated with psychosis-spectrum conditions. Clinically, this manifests as heightened distractibility, sensory sensitivity, and the tendency to imbue mundane events with personal significance – in extreme cases, feeding into delusional belief formation.

分裂型特质（Schizotypy）与精神病倾向： 除了临床诊断的精神分裂症，研究人员还研究了分裂型特质——这是一种反映普通人群中具有类似精神分裂症特征的轻微版本的偏好/神经心理特质。高分裂型特质个体（尤其是阳性分裂型程度高的人，意味着他们有更多不寻常的知觉体验和魔幻思维，而非仅仅是社交退缩）在多项研究中也表现出潜在抑制减弱。在经典实验中，分裂型量表得分较高的学生或志愿者对预暴露刺激的学习速度比得分较低的人快（表明 LI 较少），尽管他们都是非临床人群。与患者一样，高分裂型群体为预暴露的线索分配了更大的显著性，未能忽略它们。有趣的是，当使用与不寻常经历/幻觉倾向相关的测量指标（如分裂型人格问卷或某些子量表）时，其 LI 缺陷似乎最为稳固。这表明，正是分裂型特质中“易患精神病”的变体——即那些具有丰富想象力或感知生活的人——与低潜在抑制重合。相比之下，那些仅表现为“退缩”或认知混乱而没有不寻常感知的人，其效应可能不那么强烈。分裂型研究中也存在一些细微差别：例如，一项研究发现，高分裂型参与者仅在预暴露次数相对较少时表现出 LI 缺陷，但如果刺激被预暴露多次（30 次以上），最终即使是高分裂型个体也会表现出潜在抑制。这暗示具有精神病倾向的人对冗余信息的习惯化可能较慢——过滤器不那么容易启动——但给予足够的重复，他们也能学会忽略刺激（即冗余输入的显著性下降得更缓慢）。其他研究使用了组内设计，有时未能发现效应，或发现只有某些分裂型测量指标与 LI 相关，从而引发了一些争议。然而，从元分析（meta-analytically）的角度来看，证据的权重表明高分裂型特质与跨模态的潜在抑制降低相关，这镜像了精神分裂症的研究发现。这扩展了 LLI 作为一个连续体的观点：即使在“正常”人群中，那些遗传或特质上带有较高类精神病经历载量的人也表现出渗漏型的感官-注意过滤器。事实上，分裂型研究非常有价值，因为它避免了患者研究中存在的药物治疗和住院干扰因素。底线在于，精神分裂症患者（尤其是未用药且处于急性期的患者）和高分裂型个体都表现出低潜在抑制，这支持了 LLI 是与精神病谱系状况相关的核心认知易感性的观点。在临床上，这表现为注意力分散度增加、感官敏感度提高，以及倾向于赋予平凡事件以个人意义——在极端情况下，这会演变为妄想信念的形成。

Attention-Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)

Another population in which low latent inhibition has been noted is ADHD, a disorder characterized by attentional dysregulation, impulsivity, and hyperactivity. Superficially, one might expect that the distractibility and inability to concentrate seen in ADHD could stem from a failure to filter out irrelevant stimuli – essentially an attentional gate that is too porous. Some theoretical accounts indeed label ADHD as a condition of “hypo-filtering”, where the individual’s focus is frequently captured by extraneous environmental stimuli. There is evidence supporting this view: people with ADHD often report feeling “flooded” or overwhelmed by sensory input, unable to ignore background sights or sounds, which can derail their focus. This subjective flooding is congruent with the notion of reduced latent inhibition or other gating deficits in ADHD. Empirically, a few studies have directly examined latent inhibition in ADHD. The results are intriguing: one study with adults found that, off medication, adults with ADHD showed latent inhibition comparable to healthy controls, but when on their stimulant medication (methylphenidate), they actually showed significantly less latent inhibition than controls. In this experiment, off-med ADHD participants and control participants both had a normal LI effect (pre-exposure slowed learning), but when the ADHD group took their stimulant and repeated the task, the pre-exposure no longer made much difference – their ability to ignore the pre-exposed distractor was diminished. At first glance this is puzzling, since we think of ADHD medication as improving attention. The authors explained it in terms of attentional allocation: the stimulant drug likely caused the ADHD individuals to hyper-focus on the primary task features, inadvertently suppressing their processing of the pre-exposed stimulus during the exposure phase. As a result, that stimulus was not effectively learned as “irrelevant,” and when it later became relevant, the medicated ADHD subjects learned about it quickly (appearing as reduced LI). In simpler terms, the medication helped them focus so tightly that they didn’t even register the distractor stimulus initially – so it remained fresh/novel in the test phase, producing no latent inhibition. This finding highlights that the manifestation of LLI in ADHD can depend on context and treatment. It suggests that unmedicated ADHD individuals may have moderately low latent inhibition, but stimulants can paradoxically increase their gating of irrelevant stimuli to the point of essentially zero pre-exposure effect. Other research aligns with the idea that baseline, ADHD involves some sensory gating deficits: for example, children and adults with ADHD often have reduced P50 suppression and impaired prepulse inhibition, indicating difficulties in filtering sensory information at pre-attentive levels. These physiological measures correlate with attention problems. The picture that emerges is that ADHD minds may naturally be more open to a wide array of stimuli, which has a downside in conventional settings (distractibility) but might also endow some creative advantages (as discussed later). In day-to-day behavior, someone with LLI and ADHD might be the person who notices every sound in the room, every object on their desk, and whose train of thought is constantly diverted by associations triggered from the environment. Indeed, a comparison of attentional styles can be illustrative:

另一个被注意到存在低潜在抑制的群体是 ADHD（注意缺陷/多动障碍），这是一种以注意力失调、冲动和多动为特征的障碍。从表面上看，人们可能会认为 ADHD 中表现出的分心和无法集中注意力可能源于无法过滤无关刺激——本质上是一个过于“多孔”的注意力门控。一些理论解释确实将 ADHD 标记为一种“低过滤（hypo-filtering）”状态，即个体的焦点频繁被无关的环境刺激所捕捉。有证据支持这一观点：ADHD 患者经常报告感到被感官输入“淹没”或压倒，无法忽略背景中的视觉或听觉信息，这会扰乱他们的专注力。这种主观的淹没感与 ADHD 中潜在抑制降低或其他门控缺陷的观点是一致的。在实证方面，已有几项研究直接考察了 ADHD 中的潜在抑制。结果非常有趣：一项针对成人的研究发现，在不服药的情况下，ADHD 成年人的潜在抑制水平与健康对照组相当；但当他们服用刺激性药物（利他林）时，他们表现出的潜在抑制显著低于对照组。在这个实验中，未服药的 ADHD 组和对照组都有正常的 LI 效应（预暴露减慢了学习速度），但当 ADHD 组服用兴奋剂并重复任务时，预暴露不再产生明显影响——他们忽略预暴露干扰物的能力减弱了。乍一看这令人费解，因为我们认为 ADHD 药物能改善注意力。作者将其解释为注意力的分配（attentional allocation）问题：兴奋剂药物可能导致 ADHD 个体过度专注于主要任务特征，无意中抑制了他们在预暴露阶段对该刺激的处理。结果，该刺激未能被有效地习得为“无关信息”，当它后来变得相关时，服药后的 ADHD 受试者能迅速学习它（表现为 LI 降低）。简单来说，药物帮助他们过于紧密地专注于任务，以至于最初根本没有登记干扰刺激——因此在测试阶段，该刺激保持了新鲜感/新颖性，从而没有产生潜在抑制。这一发现强调了 ADHD 中 LLI 的表现取决于背景和治疗。它表明，未服药的 ADHD 个体可能具有中等程度的低潜在抑制，但兴奋剂可以矛盾地增加他们对无关刺激的门控，以至于产生几乎为零的预暴露效应。其他研究也支持 ADHD 基准状态涉及某些感觉门控缺陷的观点：例如，患有 ADHD 的儿童和成人通常表现出 P50 抑制减弱和前脉冲抑制（PPI）受损，这表明他们在前注意阶段（pre-attentive levels）过滤感觉信息存在困难。这些生理指标与注意力问题相关。由此描绘出的图景是，ADHD 的大脑可能天然地对广泛的刺激持开放态度，这在常规环境下有弊端（易分心），但也可能赋予某些创造性优势（稍后讨论）。在日常行为中，具有 LLI 和 ADHD 的人可能是那个会注意到房间里每一个声音、桌上每一个物体的人，其思绪不断被环境触发的联结所转移。事实上，注意力风格的对比非常具有说明性：

  • Typical individuals (with average latent inhibition) can focus on the task at hand and relatively easily tune out irrelevant background stimuli.

  • Individuals with ADHD tend to focus on all the irrelevant stimuli rather than sustaining attention on the single task, leading to scattered and shifting focus.

  • People with low latent inhibition (including some artists or creatives) are able to attend to both the relevant task and the seemingly irrelevant details simultaneously, and may unconsciously associate the two in novel ways.

  • 典型个体（具有平均水平的潜在抑制）能够专注于当下的任务，并相对容易地屏蔽无关的背景刺激。
  • ADHD 个体倾向于关注“所有”无关刺激，而不是将注意力持续集中在单一任务上，导致焦点分散且不断偏移。
  • 低潜在抑制者（包括一些艺术家或创意人士）能够同时关注相关任务和看似无关的细节，并可能在潜意识中以新颖的方式将两者联系起来。

These contrasting profiles highlight that LLI in ADHD is often experienced as a challenge (unable to prioritize one stream of information), whereas in a creative context the ability to hold multiple strands of information (relevant and peripheral) in mind can be advantageous. It is important to note that ADHD is heterogeneous, and not all attentional problems are due to low latent inhibition per se (some are due to executive function deficits, working memory issues, etc.). However, sensory and selective attention filters are clearly a piece of the ADHD puzzle, and low latent inhibition provides one explanatory framework: ADHD individuals have a “noisy” brain environment with many inputs active, which can both hinder linear concentration and promote out-of-the-box connections. As we will see, there is growing interest in the overlapping features of ADHD and creative cognition – some even dub ADHD a potential “creativity superpower” linked to leaky attention.

这些对比鲜明的特征强调了，ADHD 中的 LLI 通常被视为一种挑战（无法优先处理某一流向的信息），而在创作背景下，同时在脑中保持多条信息链（相关的和边缘的）的能力可能是有利的。需要注意的是，ADHD 具有异质性，并非所有的注意力问题都源于低潜在抑制本身（有些是由于执行功能缺陷、工作记忆问题等）。然而，感觉和选择性注意过滤器显然是 ADHD 谜题中的一块拼图，而低潜在抑制提供了一个解释框架：ADHD 个体拥有一个“嘈杂”的大脑环境，其中有许多激活的输入，这既可能阻碍线性专注，也可能促进“跳出框架”的联结。正如我们将看到的，人们对 ADHD 与创造性认知重叠特征的兴趣日益浓厚——有些人甚至称 ADHD 为一种与“渗漏型注意”相关的潜在“创造力超能力”。

Other Psychopathologies and Conditions

Beyond schizophrenia and ADHD, researchers have explored latent inhibition in a few other conditions, though the evidence is more sparse. Bipolar disorder, particularly during manic or hypomanic episodes, often involves racing thoughts and distractibility, suggesting that latent inhibition might be reduced in mania. While direct LI studies in bipolar patients are limited, the cognitive similarity between mania and the schizotypy/ADHD profiles (i.e. high distractibility, broad associative thinking) implies that manic states could feature LLI-like cognitive disinhibition. Manic individuals sometimes report heightened awareness of sensations and an inability to filter (along with creative surges), which could stem from a loosened latent inhibition, but more empirical work is needed. Autism spectrum disorder (ASD) is another interesting case: individuals with ASD often report sensory hypersensitivity (not filtering out background noise, for example). There is some overlap here, but autism’s attentional profile can differ (hyper-focus on certain details, but extreme aversion or distress at sensory inundation). While ASD research has extensively studied habituation and sensory gating (e.g., reduced habituation to stimuli is common in autism), latent inhibition per se has not been a major focus. One could hypothesize that some autistic individuals have low latent inhibition in certain domains (leading them to notice fine details neurotypicals might miss), yet in other ways they might over-filter or insist on sameness. Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and other anxiety disorders involve hyper-vigilance to threat cues – interestingly, a recent line of work examines whether enhancing latent inhibition before trauma exposure could increase resilience (essentially “pre-exposing” individuals to benign cues to reduce future fear learning). This is a bit tangential to our focus, but it highlights that latent inhibition (and by extension LLI) has relevance to how strongly or loosely someone forms associations, which in PTSD can mean the difference between shrugging off a loud noise versus developing a strong fear response. Generally, any psychopathology with sensory sensitivity, over-association, or distractibility might involve elements of low latent inhibition. For instance, obsessive–compulsive disorder (OCD) patients sometimes are unable to dismiss intrusive thoughts or irrelevant stimuli, possibly reflecting a failure to inhibit certain internal stimuli. However, direct empirical evidence linking OCD to latent inhibition tasks is not well established. Substance use can also transiently induce LLI: psychedelic drugs or cannabis, for example, often make users acutely aware of sensory details they normally ignore – essentially a temporary lowering of latent inhibition, which can feel enlightening or overwhelming depending on context. This drug-induced LLI further underscores dopamine’s role (as many drugs that reduce LI act on dopaminergic or related pathways).

除精神分裂症和 ADHD 外，研究人员还探索了其他几种状况中的潜在抑制，尽管证据相对较少。双相情感障碍，特别是在躁狂或轻躁狂发作期间，通常涉及思维奔逸和易分心，这表明躁狂期间潜在抑制可能会降低。虽然对双相障碍患者的直接 LI 研究有限，但躁狂与分裂型特质/ADHD 谱系之间的认知相似性（即高分心、广泛的联想思维）暗示躁狂状态可能具有类似 LLI 的认知去抑制特征。躁狂者有时报告对感觉的敏锐度提高以及无法过滤（伴随创造力激增），这可能源于潜在抑制的松动，但仍需更多实证研究。自闭症谱系障碍 (ASD) 是另一个有趣的案例：ASD 个体经常报告感官超敏（例如无法过滤背景噪音）。这里存在一些重叠，但自闭症的注意力特征可能有所不同（对某些细节过度关注，但对感官淹没表现出极度的反感或痛苦）。虽然自闭症研究广泛探讨了习惯化和感觉门控（例如对刺激的习惯化减弱在自闭症中很常见），但潜在抑制本身并非主要关注点。可以假设，某些自闭症个体在特定领域具有低潜在抑制（导致他们注意到神经典型者可能错过的细微之处），但在其他方面，他们可能会过度过滤或坚持同一性。创伤后应激障碍 (PTSD) 和其他焦虑障碍涉及对威胁线索的高度警觉——有趣的是，最近的一项研究探讨了在暴露于创伤前增强潜在抑制是否能增加韧性（本质上是通过对良性线索进行“预暴露”来减少未来的恐惧学习）。这与我们的重点略有偏离，但它强调了潜在抑制（以及延伸出的 LLI）与一个人形成联结的强度或松散度有关，在 PTSD 中，这可能意味着“对大声噪音一笑了之”与“产生强烈恐惧反应”之间的区别。总的来说，任何具有感官敏感性、过度联想或易分心特征的精神病理学都可能涉及低潜在抑制的元素。例如，强迫症 (OCD) 患者有时无法排除侵入性想法或无关刺激，这可能反映了对某些内部刺激的抑制失败。然而，将 OCD 与潜在抑制任务联系起来的直接实证证据尚未完全确立。药物使用也能瞬时诱发 LLI：例如，致幻剂或大麻常使使用者敏锐地意识到他们通常忽略的感觉细节——本质上是潜在抑制的暂时降低，根据环境不同，这可能让人感到富有启发性或难以承受。这种药物诱导的 LLI 进一步强调了多巴胺的作用（因为许多降低 LI 的药物都作用于多巴胺或相关通路）。

In summary, low latent inhibition is a transdiagnostic feature that appears in varied forms in different disorders. In schizophrenia-spectrum and high psychosis-proneness, LLI is strongly linked to positive symptoms (hallucinations, delusional or magical thinking) – the person cannot filter perceptions and thoughts, leading to bizarre or novel combinations that feel real. In ADHD, LLI contributes to distractibility – the individual’s attention flits to extraneous stimuli that others would tune out. In other conditions like mania or possibly OCD, LLI might underlie racing thoughts or inability to ignore certain impulses. Importantly, LLI in clinical contexts is often impairing, as it interferes with goal-directed activity and reality testing. Yet, as we explore next, a similar cognitive profile can be highly beneficial in non-clinical contexts that reward originality and divergent thinking. Understanding LLI thus offers a unique window into the fine line between pathology and creativity.

总而言之，低潜在抑制是一种跨诊断特征（transdiagnostic feature），在不同的障碍中以多种形式出现。在精神分裂症谱系和高精神病倾向中，LLI 与阳性症状（幻觉、妄想或魔幻思维）紧密相关——个体无法过滤感知和想法，导致产生感觉真实的离奇或新颖的组合。在 ADHD 中，LLI 导致了分心——个体的注意力飘向他人会屏蔽的额外刺激。在躁狂或可能的 OCD 等其他状况中，LLI 可能是思维奔逸或无法忽略某些冲动的基础。重要的是，临床背景下的 LLI 通常是致残性的，因为它干扰了目标导向的活动和现实检验。然而，正如我们接下来将探讨的，在奖励原创性和发散性思维的非临床背景下，类似的认知特征可能非常有益。因此，理解 LLI 为揭示病理与创造力之间的微妙界线提供了一个独特的窗口。

LLI in Creativity and Personality Traits

One of the most fascinating aspects of low latent inhibition is its positive correlation with creative thought and high creative achievement in people who are otherwise psychologically healthy. A growing body of research suggests that the same “leaky” filters that can produce symptoms in one context may, in combination with other factors, foster exceptional creativity in another context. In this section, we discuss how LLI relates to creativity, intelligence, and personality traits such as openness to experience and divergent thinking ability.

低潜在抑制最引人入胜的方面之一，是它与心理健康的个体的创造性思维及高创造性成就之间的正相关关系。日益增多的研究表明，在一种背景下可能产生症状的“渗漏型”过滤器，在另一种背景下若与其他因素结合，则可能催生非凡的创造力。在本节中，我们将讨论 LLI 如何与创造力、智力以及经验开放性（Openness to Experience）和发散性思维（Divergent Thinking）等人格特质相互关联。

Creativity, Intelligence, and Low Latent Inhibition

The link between LLI and creativity first gained attention in the early 2000s through studies by Carson, Peterson, and Higgins. In a landmark finding, Carson et al. (2003) showed that highly creative individuals are far more likely to have reduced latent inhibition compared to their less creative peers. In their study, creative achievement was measured (using an inventory of real-world creative accomplishments), and latent inhibition was assessed with a standard lab task. They found that among high-functioning, high-IQ university students, those with the highest levels of creative accomplishment were **7 times more likely to exhibit low latent inhibition** compared to students with more modest creative achievement. This striking difference is illustrated in Figure 1, which contrasts the proportion of people with low vs. high LI in groups of high creative achievers versus average achievers:

LLI 与创造力之间的联系最早在 21 世纪初通过卡森（Carson）、彼得森（Peterson）和希金斯（Higgins）的研究引起关注。在一项具有里程碑意义的发现中，卡森等人（2003）表明，与创造力较低的同龄人相比，高创造性个体具有减弱的潜在抑制的可能性要大得多。在他们的研究中，创造性成就通过量表进行衡量（使用真实世界的创造性成果清单），而潜在抑制则通过标准的实验任务进行评估。他们发现，在功能良好、高智商（High-IQ）的大学生中，创造性成就最高者的低潜在抑制发生率比成就平平的学生高出 7 倍。这种显著差异在图 1 中得到了体现，该图对比了高创造性成就组与普通成就组中低 LI 个体与高 LI 个体的比例：

Figure 1: Distribution of latent inhibition levels among individuals with low versus high creative achievement. In Carson et al. (2003), eminent creative achievers were far more likely to have reduced (low) latent inhibition (dark bars) than controls, suggesting a strong association between LLI and creative potential. High latent inhibition (light bars) was relatively uncommon in the highly creative group.

Carson and colleagues interpreted these results as evidence that cognitive disinhibition – operationalized as low latent inhibition – contributes to creative thinking by increasing the unfiltered information available for recombination into novel ideas. In other words, creative individuals may benefit from unconsciously considering a wider range of stimuli and concepts, including those that most people would deem irrelevant. This broader spectrum of mental elements can lead to the formation of remote associations and original solutions. Notably, Carson’s work also emphasized that LLI on its own is not sufficient for creativity – it must be paired with strong cognitive abilities or other controls to yield productive outcomes. This gave rise to what is known as the “dual-factor” or high IQ + low LI hypothesis. The idea is that high intelligence or high executive functioning acts as a protective or enabling factor that allows a person to harness the torrent of stimuli from LLI in a constructive way. Without that protection, LLI might simply cause overload or psychosis (as seen in schizophrenia). With high IQ, however, the person can sift, integrate, and make use of the abundant stimuli, channeling them into creative ideation rather than being drowned by them. This hypothesis is essentially a cognitive extension of the shared vulnerability model (discussed below) – low latent inhibition is a neutral vulnerability that tilts toward creativity when combined with a high-functioning brain, or toward mental illness when combined with other risk factors.

卡森及其同事将这些结果解释为：认知去抑制（操作化为低潜在抑制）通过增加可供重组为新颖想法的未经审查信息，从而促进了创造性思维。换句话说，创造性个体可能受益于在潜意识中考虑更广泛的刺激和概念，包括那些大多数人认为无关的信息。这种更广谱的心理元素可以导致远程联结（Remote Associations）的形成和原创解决方案的产生。值得注意的是，卡森的研究还强调，LLI 本身不足以产生创造力——它必须与强大的认知能力或其他控制机制相结合才能产生富有成效的结果。这便产生了所谓的“双因素”或“高智商 + 低 LI”假设。该观点认为，高智力或高执行功能充当了一种保护性或赋能因素，允许一个人以建设性的方式驾驭来自 LLI 的信息洪流。如果没有这种保护，LLI 可能只会导致过载或精神病（如精神分裂症所示）。然而，在高智商的情况下，个体可以筛选、整合并利用丰富的刺激，将它们转化为创造性的构思，而不是被它们淹没。这一假设本质上是“共享脆弱性模型”（Shared Vulnerability Model，下文讨论）在认知上的延伸——低潜在抑制是一种中性的脆弱性，当与高功能大脑结合时，它向创造力倾斜；而当与其他风险因素结合时，则向精神疾病倾斜。

Empirical support for the “LLI + IQ = creativity” model comes not only from the original Carson study but also replications and extensions. For example, Kéri (2011) found that reduced latent inhibition correlated with higher creative performance in tasks, but particularly among individuals who also had high scores on IQ and/or working memory measures. In one sample of young adults, those who achieved creative distinction (such as producing highly original art or research) were predominantly those who had both above-average intelligence and very low latent inhibition. Meanwhile, individuals with low LI but more average cognitive ability did not show creative advantages and could even be at risk for cognitive difficulties. This aligns with the notion that raw influx of information (LLI) needs a well-equipped cognitive system to be processed advantageously. Figure 2 provides a conceptual diagram of this idea, as part of the shared vulnerability model of creativity and psychopathology:

支持“LLI + IQ = 创造力”模型的实证证据不仅来自卡森最初的研究，还来自后续的复制和扩展研究。例如，Kéri (2011) 发现，潜在抑制的降低与任务中更高的创造性表现相关，但这种相关性特别存在于那些在智商和/或工作记忆测量中得分较高的个体中。在一个青年样本中，那些取得卓越创造性成就（如创作出高度原创的艺术或研究成果）的人，绝大多数是那些既拥有高于平均水平的智力，又拥有极低潜在抑制的人。与此同时，具有低 LI 但认知能力平平的个体并未表现出创造优势，甚至可能面临认知困难的风险。这符合以下观点：原始信息的涌入 (LLI) 需要一个装备精良的认知系统才能进行有利的加工。图 2 提供了这一观点的概念图，作为创造力和精神病理学“共享脆弱性模型”的一部分：

Figure 2: “Shared Vulnerability” model (adapted from Carson) illustrating how attenuated latent inhibition and related factors (novelty-seeking, hyperconnectivity) form a core susceptibility trait. If coupled with protective factors like high IQ, strong working memory, and cognitive flexibility (left triangle), the outcome may be high creativity. If coupled with risk factors like low IQ, working memory deficits, or perseverative thinking (right triangle), the outcome may be psychopathology. In essence, LLI can contribute to genius or mental illness depending on the individual’s broader cognitive context.

图 2：“共享脆弱性”模型（改编自 Carson），说明了减弱的潜在抑制及相关因素（寻求新颖性、超连接性）如何形成核心易感特质。如果与保护性因素（如高智商、强大的工作记忆和认知灵活性，见左侧三角形）结合，结果可能是高创造力。如果与风险因素（如低智商、工作记忆缺陷或强迫性思维，见右侧三角形）结合，结果可能是精神病理学。本质上，LLI 究竟贡献于天才还是精神疾病，取决于个体更广泛的认知背景。

The above model underscores a crucial point: latent inhibition itself is a neutral mechanism – neither inherently “good” nor “bad.” Attenuating this mechanism (i.e. having LLI) simply means more stimuli pass through. It’s the interaction with other traits that determines the functional impact. For a person with a nimble, high-capacity mind, low latent inhibition might fuel creative ideation, original problem solving, and artistic innovation, because they can make novel associations and still impose order on the thoughts (the proverbial ability to “think outside the box”). There are many anecdotal examples of famously creative individuals who reportedly noticed incessant details or had unusually broad attention. For instance, creative geniuses like Nikola Tesla and Leonardo da Vinci were known for their capacity to take inspiration from the tiniest observations in the environment – a capacity one might link to LLI. Empirical research finds that low latent inhibition is associated with high scores on divergent thinking tests and with real-world creative accomplishments. A recent 2025 study by Badiola-Lekue et al. confirmed that individuals who exhibited lower LI in an experiment scored significantly higher on a divergent thinking task (Alternative Uses Task), producing more fluent and flexible ideas for object uses. This reinforces the notion that “leaky attention” indeed contributes to creative potential by allowing uncommon ideas to emerge.

上述模型强调了一个关键点：潜在抑制本身是一种中性机制——既非内在的“好”，也非内在的“坏”。减弱这一机制（即拥有 LLI）仅仅意味着更多的刺激能够通过。正是与其他特质的相互作用决定了其功能性影响。对于一个思维敏捷、容量极大的大脑来说，低潜在抑制可能会激发创造性构思、原创性问题解决和艺术创新，因为他们可以建立新颖的联结，同时仍能对思想施加秩序（即所谓的“跳出框架思考”的能力）。许多著名的创造性个体都有据称注意到不间断的细节或拥有异常广泛注意力的轶事。例如，像尼古拉·特斯拉（Nikola Tesla）和列奥纳多·达·芬奇（Leonardo da Vinci）这样的创意天才，以能够从环境中极其微小的观察中汲取灵感而闻名——这种能力可能与 LLI 有关。实证研究发现，低潜在抑制与发散性思维测试的高分以及现实世界的创造性成就相关。Badiola-Lekue 等人 2025 年的一项最新研究证实，在实验中表现出较低 LI 的个体，在发散性思维任务（Alternative Uses Task，物品用途替代任务）中得分显著更高，能为物品用途产生更流畅、更灵活的想法。这强化了“渗漏型注意”确实通过允许不寻常的想法浮现，从而贡献于创造潜能的观点。

At the same time, the dual-factor model warns that if someone has low latent inhibition without the cognitive management skills, the excess stimuli can lead to chaotic thinking or distress rather than creativity. This may explain why low latent inhibition is found in both creative groups and schizophrenia – but the average person with schizophrenia often does not have high IQ or robust executive function (those abilities are often impaired by the illness), so the outcome is disorganized thought rather than creative product. By contrast, an intellectually gifted person with mild schizotypal tendencies might leverage LLI to generate exceptionally novel ideas yet stay grounded enough to refine and implement them. This aligns with the concept of the “mad genius” debate: small doses of the “madness” cognition (cognitive disinhibition, strange associations) might enhance creativity, provided the person is not overwhelmed by them. Indeed, some research suggests an inverted-U or dose-dependent relationship – a little bit of psychosis-proneness (or LLI) can boost creative originality, but too much leads to dysfunction.

与此同时，双因素模型警告说，如果某人在拥有低潜在抑制的同时缺乏认知管理技能，过量的刺激可能导致思维混乱或痛苦，而非创造力。这也许可以解释为什么在创造性群体和精神分裂症群体中都能发现低潜在抑制——但患有精神分裂症的普通人通常不具备高智商或强健的执行功能（这些能力往往被疾病损害），因此结果是思维混乱而非创造性产物。相比之下，一个具有轻微分裂型倾向的天才智力者，可能会利用 LLI 产生异常新颖的想法，同时保持足够的清醒去完善和实施它们。这与“疯才（mad genius）”辩论的概念一致：小剂量的“疯狂”认知（认知去抑制、奇怪的联结）可能会增强创造力，前提是该个体不被它们压垮。事实上，一些研究表明存在一种倒 U 型或剂量依赖型关系——少量的精神病倾向（或 LLI）可以提升创造性的原创性，但过多则会导致功能障碍。

Personality Traits Associated with LLI (Openness, Schizotypy, etc.)

LLI doesn’t only correlate with creativity and intelligence measures; it also shows up in specific personality traits. Chief among these is Openness to Experience, one of the Big Five personality dimensions. Openness reflects imagination, curiosity, preference for novelty, and broad interests – conceptually, one can see why it might link to a wide attentional focus. Several studies have found that people who score high on Openness tend to have lower latent inhibition. For example, Peterson and Carson (2002) reported that in a sample of high-achieving students, those high in Openness (and also those high in Extraversion) had sixsgnificantly reduced LI compared to those lower on those traits. High Openness individuals are intellectually curious and prone to absorb lots of information, which fits the profile of weaker filtering. Extraversion was also associated with lower LI in that study, possibly because extraverts seek stimulation and may have a broader scope of attention socially and environmentally. Notably, Openness is a known correlate of creativity as well – creative people almost invariably score high in Openness – so this trait might be a personality manifestation of the same cognitive style that LLI indexes.

LLI 不仅与创造力和智力测量相关，还体现在特定的人格特质中。其中最主要的是经验开放性（Openness to Experience），这是大五人格维度之一。开放性反映了想象力、好奇心、对新颖性的偏好以及广泛的兴趣——从概念上看，不难理解为什么它可能与广泛的注意焦点相关联。多项研究发现，在开放性上得分较高的人往往具有较低的潜在抑制。例如，Peterson 和 Carson (2002) 报告称，在一个高成就学生样本中，高开放性者（以及高外向性者）的 LI 比那些在这些特质上得分较低的人显著降低。高开放性个体具有求知欲，倾向于吸收大量信息，这符合弱过滤特征。在那项研究中，外向性（Extraversion）也与较低的 LI 相关，可能是因为外向者追求刺激，并且在社交和环境方面拥有更广泛的注意范围。值得注意的是，开放性也是已知的创造力相关因素——创造性人才在开放性上的得分几乎总是很高——因此这一特质可能是 LLI 所索引的同种认知风格在人格上的表现。

Another trait already discussed is schizotypy, particularly its positive, imaginative facets. High schizotypy (within nonclinical ranges) means a person is prone to unusual perceptual experiences, fantasy, and loose associative thinking. As detailed earlier, positive schizotypal traits correlate with low latent inhibition, and moreover these are the very traits that in mild form often correlate with creativity. It has been observed that creative individuals (artists, writers) score higher on certain schizotypy questionnaires – basically, they have a streak of seeing the world differently, akin to “healthy schizotypy.” Researchers Batey & Furnham (and others) have found that the “unusual experiences” dimension of schizotypy is associated with creative achievement, whereas the “negative/disorganized” dimension is not. The unusual experiences aspect is precisely the one tied to less filtering of stimuli (seeing patterns where others don’t, etc.). Thus it’s likely that the personality trait of having odd or original perceptions (a mild schizotypy) overlaps with LLI and contributes to creativity. Many eminent creative people have described experiences that sound like mild psychosis or at least very vivid imagination. For instance, some report hearing voices of characters (common for novelists) or seeing visual images of their work before executing it – not to the level of true hallucinations, but enough to suggest their brains blur the boundary between real and imagined stimuli (again hinting at reduced inhibition of internally generated stimuli).

另一个已经讨论过的特质是分裂型特质（Schizotypy），尤其是其积极、富有想象力的方面。高分裂型（在非临床范围内）意味着一个人倾向于不寻常的知觉体验、幻想和松散的联结思维。正如前文详述，积极的分裂型特质与低潜在抑制相关，而且这些特质在轻微形式下往往与创造力相关。据观察，创造性个体（艺术家、作家）在某些分裂型问卷上的得分较高——基本上，他们具有一种看待世界的独特方式，类似于“健康的分裂型”。研究人员 Batey 和 Furnham（及其他人）发现，分裂型特质中的“不寻常经历”维度与创造性成就相关，而“阴性/紊乱”维度则不然。不寻常经历这一维度恰恰与较少的刺激过滤（在他人看不到的地方看到模式等）有关。因此，很可能拥有奇特或原创感知的人格特质（一种轻微的分裂型特质）与 LLI 重叠，并贡献于创造力。许多杰出的创意人才曾描述过听起来像轻微精神病或至少是极其生动的想象体验。例如，有些人报告能听到角色的声音（这在小说家中很常见），或在执行作品前能看到作品的可视图像——这虽然未达到真实幻觉的程度，但足以表明他们的大脑模糊了真实刺激与想象刺激之间的边界（再次暗示了对内部生成刺激的抑制减少）。

Beyond openness and schizotypy, traits like novelty-seeking and tolerance for ambiguity are likely relevant. Novelty-seeking (a tendency to actively pursue new experiences and stimuli) has been linked to both creativity and to dopaminergic systems. Someone high in novelty-seeking may deliberately expose themselves to lots of stimuli, effectively lowering latent inhibition by behavior (if not by innate cognition). Additionally, tolerance of ambiguity or chaos could be considered a personality factor that determines whether LLI becomes an advantage or a handicap. Creative individuals often have the personality strength to withstand disordered or unpredictable situations, whereas others might become anxious or uncomfortable.

除了开放性和分裂型特质，像寻求新颖性（Novelty-seeking）和对模糊性的容忍度（Tolerance for ambiguity）等特质可能也相关。寻求新颖性（主动追求新体验和新刺激的倾向）已被证明与创造力和多巴胺系统都有联系。一个高度寻求新颖性的人可能会故意让自己暴露在大量刺激中，从而通过行为（即使不是通过先天认知）有效地降低了潜在抑制。此外，对模糊或混乱的容忍度可以被视为决定 LLI 变成优势还是障碍的人格因素。创造性个体通常具有承受无序或不可预测情况的人格力量，而其他人可能会因此变得焦虑或不安。

It’s also worth noting that LLI has been related to the personality construct of “psychoticism” in Eysenck’s taxonomy. Psychoticism (as per Eysenck’s old theory) is a trait involving aggressiveness, impulsivity, and creative or divergent thinking – a somewhat outdated concept, but studies in the 1980s found that people scoring high on psychoticism scales showed reduced latent inhibition similar to what was later framed as schizotypy. This again ties the low LI phenomenon to a continuum of personality that ranges from normal creativity to pathological psychosis-proneness.

值得注意的是，在艾森克（Eysenck）的人格分类学中，LLI 与“精神质”（Psychoticism）人格构念有关。精神质（根据艾森克的旧理论）是一个涉及攻击性、冲动性以及创造性或发散性思维的特质——这虽是一个略显过时的概念，但 20 世纪 80 年代的研究发现，在精神质分表上得分较高的人表现出潜在抑制减弱，这与后来定义的“分裂型特质”非常相似。这再次将低 LI 现象与一个从正常创造力到病理性的精神病倾向的人格连续体联系起来。

In summary, certain personality profiles are statistically associated with low latent inhibition: high Openness to Experience, high positive schizotypy (unusual perceptual and imaginative faculties), high extraversion (perhaps due to greater environmental scanning and stimulus-seeking), and high creative temperament in general. These individuals are often described as perceptive, associative, curious, and sometimes eccentric – all of which align well with a mind that lets in a broad array of stimuli and ideas. Such traits can be incredibly generative for creative work, as the person is constantly absorbing and cross-connecting inputs. However, they may also come with quirks like distractibility, impulsiveness, or mild dissociation from consensus reality (seeing things differently). The overlap of these personality traits with those seen in mild psychopathology (like schizotypy or ADHD traits) reinforces the emerging view of a spectrum model: a bit of LLI-related trait can enhance creativity and is socially labeled as “imaginative” or “innovative,” while more extreme levels cause impairment and are labeled as “clinical.”

总而言之，某些人格特征在统计学上与低潜在抑制相关：高经验开放性、高积极分裂型特质（不寻常的感知和想象力）、高外向性（可能源于更广泛的环境扫描和刺激寻求），以及普遍的高创造性气质。这些个体通常被描述为具有敏锐洞察力、善于联想、好奇心强，有时甚至古怪——所有这些都与一个允许广泛刺激和想法进入的大脑高度契合。此类特质对于创作工作极具产出价值，因为个体在不断吸收并跨界连接各种输入。然而，它们也可能伴随着一些怪癖，如易分心、冲动或与共识现实（Consensus reality）的轻微解离（即看问题的方式与众不同）。这些人格特质与轻微精神病理学（如分裂型或 ADHD 特质）的重叠，强化了正在兴起的“谱系模型”（Spectrum model）观点：少量的 LLI 相关特质可以增强创造力，在社会中被贴上“富有想象力”或“创新”的标签；而更极端水平的 LLI 则会导致功能受损，被贴上“临床症状”的标签。

LLI, Sensory Gating, and Divergent Thinking

As mentioned earlier, low latent inhibition is conceptually related to other measures of sensory gating, and recent studies suggest that both cognitive and sensory gating deficits can benefit certain kinds of creative thinking. In one study of schoolchildren, those with lower P50 sensory gating (meaning their brains did not filter out a repeated click sound as much) scored higher on divergent thinking tasks in terms of fluency and flexibility of ideas. However, their originality scores did not differ, indicating that having more information entering awareness might help generate more ideas, though not necessarily more novel ones. This finding aligns with the notion that a dispersed, broad attentional style (lower gating) supplies a larger quantity of material for thought, which can boost the raw output of ideas (fluency), even if true originality still requires further refinement or associative leaps. Interestingly, the same study found that prepulse inhibition (a slightly later, sensorimotor gating measure) was not clearly related to creativity scores, suggesting that the early-stage gating (like P50 at ~50 milliseconds after input) might be more relevant to divergent idea generation than the motor startle gating at ~120 milliseconds. In any case, these psychophysiological results complement the cognitive LLI findings: creative performance, especially the ability to generate lots of possibilities, is linked to having a “leakier” filter at multiple levels of processing.

如前所述，低潜在抑制在概念上与其他感觉门控测量指标相关，近期研究表明，认知和感觉门控缺陷都能使某些创造性思维受益。在一项针对学龄儿童的研究中，那些 P50 感觉门控较低（意味着他们的大脑对重复点击声的过滤程度较小）的个体，在发散性思维任务的想法流畅性和灵活性方面得分更高。然而，他们的原创性得分并没有差异，这表明进入意识的信息增多可能有助于产生更多的想法，但不一定产生更独特的想法。这一发现符合以下观点：分散、广泛的注意风格（低门控）为思维提供了大量的素材，这可以提高想法的原始产量（流畅性），即便真正的原创性仍需要进一步的磨练或联想上的飞跃。有趣的是，同一项研究发现，前脉冲抑制（PPI，一种稍晚阶段的感觉运动门控指标）与创造力得分没有明确关联，这暗示早期门控（如输入后约 50 毫秒的 P50）可能比约 120 毫秒的运动惊跳门控与发散性想法的产生更相关。无论如何，这些心理生理学结果补充了认知 LLI 的发现：创造性表现，尤其是产生多种可能性的能力，与在多个加工层级上拥有一个“更渗漏”的过滤器有关。

It’s important to note that while low latent inhibition can increase creative output, it does not guarantee creative success on its own. Divergent thinking (coming up with many ideas) is only one aspect of creativity; convergent thinking (honing and selecting the best ideas) is also crucial. People with extreme LLI might excel at brainstorming wild ideas but struggle to organize or implement them. This is again where intelligence, executive function, and personality (e.g. conscientiousness, resilience) play moderating roles. Studies have not found a direct linear correlation between LI and creativity in every context – for instance, some highly creative people might not show low LI on a given lab task if they have learned to regulate their attention dynamically. Some theorists like Martindale have proposed that creative individuals may have the ability to enter a low-LI (disinhibited) state when it suits the task and then return to a more filtered state when focusing or refining. This idea of flexible latent inhibition is intriguing: rather than LLI being a fixed trait, it could be a state that creative brains can willfully invoke. While evidence for on-demand control of LI is not yet concrete, creative people do often describe cycles of idea generation (free-wheeling, absorb everything mode) and editing (critical, focus mode). It might be that they transiently relax their filters in the former phase and tighten them in the latter. Cognitive neuroscience will need to explore this (perhaps via neurofeedback or task-based fMRI) to see if highly creative brains show context-dependent changes in filtering. As of now, the prevailing evidence treats LLI mostly as a trait or stable tendency, but the potential for “phasic” latent inhibition changes remains an open question (one that Carson also noted as an opportunity for future research).

必须指出的是，虽然低潜在抑制可以增加创造性产出，但它本身并不能保证创造力的成功。发散性思维（产生许多想法）只是创造力的一面；聚合性思维（Convergent thinking，精炼并选择最佳想法）同样至关重要。具有极端 LLI 的人可能擅长头脑风暴并提出大胆想法，但在组织或实施这些想法时可能会感到吃力——这又是智力、执行功能和人格（如尽责性、韧性）发挥调节作用的地方。研究并未发现 LI 与创造力在所有背景下都存在直接的线性相关——例如，如果某些高度创造性的人学会了动态调节注意力，他们在特定的实验室任务中可能不会表现出低 LI。马丁代尔（Martindale）等理论家提出，创造性个体可能具备在任务需要时进入低 LI（去抑制）状态，并在需要专注或精炼时返回到更强过滤状态的能力。这种“灵活性潜在抑制”（Flexible latent inhibition）的观点引人入胜：LLI 可能不是一种固定的特质，而是一种创造性大脑可以有意识调用的状态。虽然目前尚无确凿证据证明对 LI 的按需控制，但创意人才确实经常描述“构思周期”（随心所欲、吸收一切的模式）和“编辑周期”（批判、专注的模式）。他们可能在前者阶段暂时放松过滤器，在后者阶段收紧过滤器。认知神经科学需要通过神经反馈或基于任务的 fMRI 进一步探索这一点。目前，主流证据仍将 LLI 视为一种特质或稳定的倾向，但“相位性（Phasic）”潜在抑制变化的可能性仍是一个待解的问题。

Research Methods and Approaches to Studying LLI

Given the interdisciplinary interest in low latent inhibition, a variety of methodological approaches have been used to study it – from behavioral experiments and cognitive tasks to neuroimaging and psychometric correlations. Each approach provides different insights and comes with certain limitations. Here we outline how LLI is typically measured and investigated:

鉴于多学科对低潜在抑制的兴趣，研究者采用了多种方法论手段——从行为实验和认知任务到神经影像和心理测量的相关性分析。每种方法都提供了不同的洞见，同时也伴随着某些局限性。以下是 LLI 通常的测量和调查方式：

Latent Inhibition Paradigms: The classic way to measure latent inhibition is through a two-phase experimental task, as described earlier. In Phase 1 (pre-exposure), participants are repeatedly exposed to a specific stimulus (the to-be-conditioned stimulus, CS) without any meaningful outcome. In Phase 2 (conditioning/test), that same stimulus is now paired with an unconditioned stimulus (US) or outcome, and the speed or success of learning the association is measured. Latent inhibition is indicated if the pre-exposed group learns the association more slowly or less fully than a control group that did not have pre-exposure. In human experiments, the stimuli and tasks can take many forms. Some examples:

潜在抑制范式： 测量潜在抑制的经典方式是采用如前所述的双阶段实验任务。在阶段 1（预暴露）中，参与者反复接触一个特定的刺激（即待条件化的刺激，CS），且不产生任何有意义的结果。在阶段 2（条件化/测试）中，该刺激与一个无条件刺激（US）或结果配对，测量建立关联的速度或成功率。如果预暴露组比没有预暴露的控制组学习关联的速度更慢或更不充分，则表明存在潜在抑制。在人类实验中，刺激和任务可以采取多种形式。例如：

  • Auditory LI task: Pre-expose participants to a certain tone or noise repeatedly while they perform an unrelated task (ensuring the sound has no consequences). Then, in the test phase, make that sound predictive of something (e.g., a reward point or a signal to press a button). Typically, participants who heard the sound earlier with no meaning will be slower to treat it as a signal now, compared to those hearing it for the first time.
  • Visual LI task: The Lubow visual search task is one variant. Participants might first see displays where a particular shape or color consistently appears but is irrelevant to the task (e.g., find a different oddball target). Later, that previously irrelevant shape/color becomes the target that they must detect. Those with strong latent inhibition will be slower to detect it (having learned to ignore it earlier), whereas those with reduced LI will more quickly switch attention to it.
  • Conditioned learning task: Ginton’s nonsense syllable experiment described earlier is a classic – exposure to syllables with or without a background noise, then using that noise as a conditioned stimulus predicting a points reward. Reaction times or number of trials to criterion serve as the measure. Other studies have used skin conductance responses (electrodermal conditioning) where a color or tone is pre-exposed and later paired with a mild aversive stimulus – the reduction in conditioned response serves as an index of LI (though interpretational confounds exist, as noted below).
    • 听觉 LI 任务： 让参与者在执行无关任务时反复暴露于某种音调或噪音（确保声音无后果）。随后，在测试阶段，使该声音具有预测性（例如，作为奖励分值或按键信号）。通常，之前听到过该声音的参与者现在将其视为信号的速度，会比初次听到的参与者慢。
    • 视觉 LI 任务： 鲁博（Lubow）的视觉搜索任务是变体之一。参与者可能首先看到一个一致出现但与任务无关的特定形状或颜色（例如，在寻找不同的异常目标时）。随后，那个之前无关的形状/颜色变成了他们必须检测的目标。具有强潜在抑制的人检测它的速度较慢（因为之前习得了忽略它），而潜在抑制减弱的人则会更快地将注意力转移到它身上。
    • 条件学习任务： 前文描述的 Ginton 无意义音节实验是经典案例——在有或没有背景噪音的情况下暴露于音节，然后将该噪音作为预测积分奖励的条件刺激。反应时或达到标准的尝试次数作为衡量指标。其他研究也使用了皮肤电导反应（电生理条件反射），即预暴露某种颜色或音调，随后将其与轻微的厌恶刺激配对——条件反应的减弱程度作为 LI 的指标。

LI paradigms have been implemented across sensory modalities (auditory, visual, even olfactory) and even across species (from mice pressing levers to humans pressing buttons), and the effect is quite robust and reproducible under controlled conditions. However, designing a good LI experiment with humans requires care. One major choice is between a between-subjects design (one group is pre-exposed, another group is not) and a within-subject design (each participant experiences both a pre-exposed stimulus and a non-pre-exposed stimulus in the conditioning phase). Between-subjects designs are simpler but prone to confounds: for example, the non-pre-exposed group finds the stimulus fully novel at test whereas the pre-exposed group might be bored by it, etc.. It’s hard to ensure the groups are identical in all respects. Within-subject designs control for individual differences and novelty effects by having each person serve as their own control. Gray et al. (1995) did a within-subject human LI study where two different sounds were used (one pre-exposed, one not) and both were later used as signals; this approach can reveal an interaction of pre-exposure and group (patients vs. controls) more cleanly. The drawback of within-subject designs is that they are more complex and participants might catch on to the purpose if not carefully constructed. In any case, methodological differences have contributed to some inconsistent findings in the literature. For example, studies that did not properly counterbalance stimuli or that used too few participants sometimes failed to detect LI differences, whereas more rigorous designs did. Additionally, subtle parameters – such as the number of pre-exposures, the time delay between pre-exposure and test, or whether a context change is introduced – can modulate LI results. Researchers must ensure that the pre-exposure is sufficient to induce a strong latent inhibition effect in control subjects, otherwise there is little room to see a “reduction” in others. Some studies (e.g., in schizotypy) initially found no LI difference until they realized that extending the number of pre-exposures revealed the group difference. Thus, replicability and effect sizes in LI research depend on careful task design.

LI 范式已在各种感觉通路（听觉、视觉，甚至嗅觉）以及不同物种（从按压杠杆的小鼠到按键的人类）中得到实现，且在受控条件下，该效应表现出相当强的稳固性和可重复性。然而，设计一个高质量的人类 LI 实验需要格外小心。一个主要的抉择在于采用组间设计（Between-subjects design，一组进行预暴露，另一组不进行）还是组内设计（Within-subject design，每个参与者在条件化阶段同时经历预暴露刺激和非预暴露刺激）。组间设计较为简单，但容易受到干扰变量（Confounds）的影响：例如，非预暴露组在测试时会觉得刺激完全新颖，而预暴露组可能已经对此感到厌烦。很难确保两组在所有方面都完全一致。组内设计则通过让每个人担任自己的对照，从而控制了个体差异和新颖性效应。格雷（Gray）等人（1995）进行了一项组内人类 LI 研究，使用了两种不同的声音（一种预暴露，另一种不预暴露），随后两者都作为信号使用；这种方法能更清晰地揭示预暴露与群体（患者组 vs. 对照组）之间的交互作用。组内设计的缺点是更为复杂，如果设计不够精巧，参与者可能会察觉到实验目的。无论如何，方法论上的差异导致了文献中出现了一些不一致的发现。例如，未能妥善平衡刺激或样本量过小的研究有时无法检测到 LI 差异，而更严谨的设计则能发现。此外，细微的参数——如预暴露次数、预暴露与测试之间的时间延迟，或是否引入了语境变化——都会调节 LI 的结果。研究人员必须确保预暴露强度足以在对照组中诱发强烈的潜在抑制效应，否则就没有足够的空间来观察他人的“减弱”。一些研究（如针对分裂型特质的研究）最初并未发现 LI 差异，直到他们意识到增加预暴露次数才能揭示出组间差异。因此，LI 研究的可重复性和效应量取决于精细的任务设计。

Psychometric and Correlational Approaches: Besides experimental tasks, another approach is to measure latent inhibition indirectly by looking at its correlates or outcomes. Many studies pair an LI task with various psychometric assessments – for instance, giving subjects personality inventories, creativity tests, or clinical symptom scales, and then seeing how latent inhibition performance correlates with those measures. We discussed several such findings (e.g., correlation of low LI with high Openness, with creative achievement, with schizotypy scores). This approach helps situate LLI within the broader nomological network of psychology. For example, one can administer the Creative Achievement Questionnaire or a divergent thinking test alongside an LI task to test the hypothesis that more creative individuals exhibit lower LI. Such studies have indeed found significant associations. Similarly, using schizotypy questionnaires (like the SPQ or O-LIFE) in nonclinical samples allows researchers to see if the people who endorse unusual perceptions or ideas are the ones who don’t show an LI effect – which, as reviewed, they often are. Multiple regression or structural equation modeling can then be used to tease apart whether, say, openness predicts creativity via the mediator latent inhibition, or if each contributes independently. Some work suggests LLI is one mediator of the creativity–psychosis link (a shared cognitive process connecting the personality extremes).

心理测量与相关法： 除了实验任务，另一种方法是通过观察其相关因素或结果来间接测量潜在抑制。许多研究将 LI 任务与各种心理测评结合——例如，让受试者填写人格量表、创造力测试或临床症状量表，然后观察潜在抑制的表现与这些测量指标之间的相关性。我们讨论过几项此类发现（例如，低 LI 与高开放性、创造性成就及分裂型分值的相关性）。这种方法有助于将 LLI 置于更广泛的心理学命名网络（Nomological network）中。例如，可以同时施测“创造性成就问卷”或发散性思维测试，以检验“高创造性个体表现出较低 LI”的假设。此类研究确实发现了显著的关联。类似地，在非临床样本中使用分裂型问卷（如 SPQ 或 O-LIFE），可以让研究人员观察那些认同不寻常感知或想法的人是否正是那些不表现出 LI 效应的人——正如前文所述，事实往往如此。随后可以使用多元回归或结构方程模型 (SEM) 来厘清：例如，开放性是否通过潜在抑制这一中介变量预测了创造力，或者三者是否相互独立地发挥作用。一些研究表明，LLI 是连接“创造力-精神病”的一座桥梁（一种连接人格极端的共享认知过程）。

From a psychometric perspective, one could also attempt to design self-report instruments to capture the subjective experience of low latent inhibition (e.g., questions about noticing things others don’t, difficulty blocking out distractions, etc.). There is no widely accepted “LLI questionnaire” at present – partly because people may not accurately introspect on what they filter out. However, items from existing scales (like “I am easily distracted by extraneous events or noises” or “I notice details that others think unimportant”) tap into similar constructs. High agreement with such statements would presumably correlate with actual low LI in tasks. Indeed, ADHD self-reports often endorse those items, and schizotypy scales include items like “Do you ever feel that insignificant things are intensely interesting or meaningful?” which connects to LLI. In practice, though, objective tasks remain the gold standard to measure LI, since self-reports can be biased by one’s beliefs or compensatory strategies.

从心理测量的角度看，也可以尝试设计自评工具来捕捉低潜在抑制的主观体验（例如，关于注意到他人未察觉之物、难以屏蔽分心物等问题）。目前尚无广泛认可的“LLI 问卷”——部分原因是个体可能无法准确反思自己过滤掉了什么。然而，现有量表中的条目（如“我很容易被无关的事件或噪音分心”或“我会注意到他人认为不重要的细节”）触及了类似的构念。对这些陈述的高度认同理论上应与任务中的实际低 LI 相关。事实上，ADHD 的自评报告通常会认同这些条目，而分裂型量表也包含诸如“你是否曾觉得微不足道的事物极度有趣或有意义？”之类的条目，这都与 LLI 有关。但在实践中，客观任务仍是测量 LI 的金标准，因为自评容易受到个人信念或补偿策略的偏差影响。

Neuroimaging and Neurophysiology: To understand the brain basis of latent inhibition, some researchers have employed neuroimaging techniques. Functional MRI (fMRI) is challenging to use with standard LI tasks, because many LI paradigms (especially those with conditioning) can be lengthy or involve subtle behavioral indices that are hard to capture in the scanner. Nonetheless, a few studies have succeeded. For instance, Young et al. (2005) used fMRI in a “learned irrelevance” paradigm (closely related to latent inhibition) and found significant activation of the hippocampus during tasks requiring subjects to ignore previously irrelevant information. This supports the earlier notion that the hippocampus is involved in tagging stimuli as irrelevant (with the fMRI showing hippocampal involvement when that learned irrelevance was engaged). Another recent fMRI study by Koolschijn et al. (2019) looked at selective memory retrieval in the face of distraction (which can be conceptually related to LI) and again highlighted hippocampal and prefrontal regions as key players in successfully ignoring irrelevant memories. These human imaging results, though limited, align with the robust animal literature that identified the hippocampal-accumbens-PFC circuit in latent inhibition. There is ample room for more neuroimaging research – for example, designing an fMRI-friendly LI task that could compare brain activation in people with high vs. low latent inhibition (perhaps extreme groups like highly creative versus controls, or schizotypy high vs. low). So far, most neurobiological insights come from animal studies (lesions, recordings, pharmacology) which we summarized earlier. Additionally, EEG/ERP methods have been used to examine neural correlates of latent inhibition. Some studies have reported that the brain’s electrophysiological response during conditioning differs if the CS was pre-exposed: for example, a measure called the contingent negative variation (CNV), which reflects expectation, builds up more slowly for a pre-exposed stimulus in controls but not in patients with schizophrenia. However, findings like these can be hard to interpret, and replication has been an issue.

神经影像与神经生理学： 为了理解潜在抑制的大脑基础，一些研究人员采用了神经影像技术。功能性磁共振成像 (fMRI) 在标准 LI 任务中的应用具有挑战性，因为许多 LI 范式（尤其是涉及条件化的）可能耗时过长，或者涉及难以在扫描仪中捕捉的细微行为指标。尽管如此，仍有少数研究取得了成功。例如，杨（Young）等人（2005）在“习得性无关”（与潜在抑制紧密相关）范式中使用 fMRI 发现，在要求受试者忽略先前无关信息的任务期间，海马体显著激活。这支持了早期的观点，即海马体参与了将刺激标记为无关的过程（fMRI 显示当这种习得性无关被调用时，海马体参与其中）。另一项近期由库尔辛（Koolschijn）等人（2019）进行的 fMRI 研究观察了面对干扰时的选择性记忆提取（概念上与 LI 相关），再次强调了海马体和前额叶区域是成功忽略无关记忆的关键角色。这些人类影像结果虽然有限，但与确定了潜在抑制中“海马体-伏隔核-前额叶回路”的稳固动物文献相一致。神经影像领域仍有广阔的研究空间——例如，设计一种适合 fMRI 的 LI 任务，以比较高、低潜在抑制者的大脑激活情况（或许是高创意组 vs. 对照组，或高低分裂型特质组）。到目前为止，大多数神经生物学见解仍源自我们在前文总结的动物研究（损毁实验、电记录、药理学）。此外，EEG/ERP（脑电图/事件相关电位）方法也被用于检查潜在抑制的神经相关物。一些研究报告称，如果在条件化阶段的 CS 曾被预暴露，大脑的电生理反应会有所不同：例如，一种反映期待感的电位——随附负偏向 (CNV)，在对照组中对预暴露刺激的建立速度较慢，但在精神分裂症患者中并非如此。然而，此类发现往往难以解释，且可重复性一直是个问题。

On the sensory gating side, electrophysiological measures (P50, N100 suppression) and startle response measures (PPI) are well-established and often used in parallel with latent inhibition to give a fuller picture of someone’s gating profile. For example, a creative individual might be assessed for both latent inhibition (cognitive) and P50 gating (sensory) to see if both are reduced; if so, that person truly has an globally “leaky” system, whereas if only one is reduced, the story is more complex. In ADHD research, EEG is used to see how the brain responds to repetitive stimuli, and indeed ADHD tends to show reduced habituation (which is analogous to poor latent inhibition). These methods complement behavioral LI tasks by showing that it’s not just in learning situations, but even in basic sensory processing, certain brains do not filter repetition as much.

在感觉门控方面，电生理测量（P50、N100 抑制）和惊跳反应测量（PPI）已非常成熟，通常与潜在抑制并行使用，以提供更全面的个体门控特征图谱。例如，可以同时评估一个创造性个体的潜在抑制（认知层）和 P50 门控（感觉层），看两者是否都降低了；如果是，那么该个体确实拥有一个全局性的“渗漏”系统；如果只有一个降低，情况则更为复杂。在 ADHD 研究中，EEG 被用来观察大脑对重复刺激的反应，事实上，ADHD 往往表现出习惯化减弱（这与潜在抑制不良类似）。这些方法通过证明在基本的感觉加工中（而不仅仅是在学习情境中）某些大脑不会对重复信息进行过多过滤，从而补充了行为 LI 任务。

Methodological Limitations and Confounds: Studying LLI is not without challenges. As hinted, latent inhibition tasks can be confounded by other phenomena if not designed carefully. One confound is “learned irrelevance” vs. “latent inhibition” – technically they are similar but some argue learned irrelevance (learning that a stimulus predicts nothing) might be slightly different from simply reduced salience. Some paradigms might inadvertently tap more into general learning deficits or attention lapses. Another issue is distinguishing latent inhibition from simple habituation or fatigue. For instance, a person might show a weak conditioned response after pre-exposure not because they filtered out the stimulus, but because they got physiologically habituated to it (especially in autonomic measures like skin conductance). One study noted that reduced electrodermal response after pre-exposure in schizophrenia could be interpreted as quicker habituation rather than a cognitive blocking of learning. Researchers have to include control conditions to parse this out (e.g., measure response during the pre-exposure phase to see if rapid habituation occurred). There’s also the factor of attention span and motivation: ironically, if someone is too inattentive during pre-exposure (daydreaming, etc.), they might not even register the stimulus enough to form a “no consequence” memory, which can make them look low-LI (since they then learn about it quickly in conditioning). This was essentially the explanation for the ADHD medication finding. Thus, participant engagement is crucial. In studies with patients, medications and symptoms add noise – antipsychotics can restore LI, stimulants can alter LI, anxiety can impair or enhance attention, etc. Many early schizophrenia studies had medicated patients, making it tricky to tell if differences were due to the illness or the drugs; newer studies try to include unmedicated patients or statistically control for medication dose.

方法论的局限与干扰： 研究 LLI 并非没有挑战。如前所述，如果不精细设计，潜在抑制任务可能会受到其他现象的干扰。一个干扰是“习得性无关”与“潜在抑制”的区分——技术上它们很相似，但有人认为习得性无关（习得一个刺激不预示任何事物）可能与单纯的显著性降低略有不同。某些范式可能无意中触及了更广泛的学习缺陷或注意力滑坡。另一个问题是将潜在抑制与简单的习惯化或疲劳区分开来。例如，一个人在预暴露后表现出较弱的条件反应，可能不是因为他过滤了刺激，而是因为他产生了生理习惯化（特别是在皮肤电导等自主神经测量中）。一项研究指出，精神分裂症患者预暴露后电皮质反应减弱，可被解释为习惯化更快，而非认知层面的学习阻断。研究人员必须包含对照条件来解析这一点（例如，测量预暴露阶段的反应，看是否发生了快速习惯化）。此外还有注意广度和动机的因素：讽刺的是，如果某人在预暴露期间过于不专注（白日梦等），他们可能根本没有充分登记刺激以形成“无后果”的记忆，这反而让他们看起来像低 LI（因为他们在条件化阶段能迅速学习该刺激）。这本质上就是对 ADHD 药物研究发现的解释。因此，参与者的参与度至关重要。在针对患者的研究中，药物和症状会增加噪音——抗精神病药可能恢复 LI，兴奋剂可能改变 LI，焦虑可能损害或增强注意力等。许多早期的精神分裂症研究都涉及已用药的患者，这使得很难判断差异是由于疾病还是药物引起的；较新的研究尝试纳入未用药患者或在统计上控制药物剂量。

Another limitation is that low latent inhibition tasks often have small effect sizes in non-extreme groups, so large sample sizes are needed. In schizotypy studies, for example, if one median-splits the sample, some people in the “high schizotypy” group might not be that high, and some “low” might not be super low, causing overlap and possibly null results. Ensuring a broad separation (e.g., top 15% vs bottom 15% of scorers) can sharpen effects but at the cost of discarding middle data. Some discrepancies in whether schizotypy correlates with LI were due to such methodological choices.

另一个局限性是，低潜在抑制任务在非极端群体中的效应量通常较小，因此需要大样本量。例如在分裂型特质研究中，如果仅对样本进行中位分割，那么“高分裂型”组中的某些人可能并没有那么高，而“低”组中的某些人也可能没那么低，导致重叠甚至得出无效结果。确保广泛的区分（例如得分最高 15% vs. 最低 15%）可以增强效应，但代价是舍弃了中间数据。分裂型特质是否与 LI 相关的某些差异正是由于此类方法论选择造成的。

In summary, the methodological toolkit for studying LLI includes behavioral conditioning tasks, cognitive performance measures, self-report/personality correlations, and neurophysiological recordings. Each provides a piece of the puzzle.
